trans-unit.source: Provides basic functionality for describing the structure of a data field at design time.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IDataSourceFieldSchema> interface allows a class to implement a set of properties that describe a field in a data source.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DataSetFieldSchema> class implements the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IDataSourceFieldSchema> interface.

Classes that implement the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IDataSourceFieldSchema> are used by custom control designer components to provide lists of data source fields and properties for data-bound controls at design time.
Gets the type of data stored in the field.
A <xref href="System.Type"></xref> object.
Gets a value indicating whether the value of the field automatically increments for each new row.
For a <xref:System.Data.DataColumn> object, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IDataSourceFieldSchema.Identity%2A> property corresponds to the <xref:System.Data.DataColumn.AutoIncrement%2A> property.
In SQL Server, an Identity column is a numerical column that automatically increments with each added record, thereby ensuring that the value uniquely identifies that record.
`true` if the field's <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.IDataSourceFieldSchema.DataType"></xref> is numeric and the underlying field increments automatically as new rows are added; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value indicating whether the field is editable.
For a <xref:System.Data.DataColumn>, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IDataSourceFieldSchema.IsReadOnly%2A> property corresponds to the <xref:System.Data.DataColumn.ReadOnly%2A> property.
`true` if the field is read-only; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value indicating whether values in the field are required to be unique.
For a <xref:System.Data.DataColumn> object, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IDataSourceFieldSchema.IsUnique%2A> property corresponds to the <xref:System.Data.DataColumn.Unique%2A> property.
`true` if data in the field must be unique; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value indicting the size of data that can be stored in the field.
For a <xref:System.Data.DataColumn> object, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IDataSourceFieldSchema.Length%2A> property corresponds to the <xref:System.Data.DataColumn.MaxLength%2A> property.
The number of bytes the field can store.
Gets the name of the field.
For a <xref:System.Data.DataColumn>object, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IDataSourceFieldSchema.Name%2A> property corresponds to the <xref:System.Data.DataColumn.ColumnName%2A> property.
The name of the field.
Gets a value indicating whether the field can accept `null` values.
For a <xref:System.Data.DataColumn> object, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IDataSourceFieldSchema.Nullable%2A> property corresponds to the <xref:System.Data.DataColumn.AllowDBNull%2A> property.
`true` if the field can accept `null` values; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the maximum number of digits used to represent a numerical value in the field.

The maximum number of digits used to represent the values of the field if the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.IDataSourceFieldSchema.DataType"></xref> property of the field represents a numeric type.
If this property is not implemented, it should return -1.
Gets a value indicating whether the field is in the primary key.
`true` if the field is in the primary key; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the number of decimal places to which numerical values in the field are resolved.

If the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.IDataSourceFieldSchema.DataType"></xref> property of the field represents a numeric type, returns the number of decimal places to which values are resolved, otherwise `-1`.
